activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Wrencher

records.addlTxt: Emailed dispatch at 11:39 AM to vacate warrant.

9:39 AM Defendant Mark A Wrencher not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a bail/bond forf. hearing
Defendant does not appear. 
BTC: WARRANT WILL REMAIN. Bond forfeiture is granted.

Back on the record at 11:27 AM with the same appearances. 
Defendant Mark Wrencher now present in court. 
Defendant provides explanation for why he missed the last court appearance. Defendant makes statements on the record. 
State puts the offer on the record. 
BTC: VACATE WARRANT and reinstate bond. Matter set over.
Return to sender - Attempted not known; unable to forward. Notice of Bail/Bond forfeiture and forfeiture Hearing
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. Missed court 8/29/2022. $500 signature bond requested/ordered forfeited.

9:56 AM Defendant Mark A Wrencher not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant does not appear. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.

records.addlTxt: DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.P  (person, property, residence or family).

2:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark A Wrencher in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
